strapiEdition.headline: What's The Worst That Could Happen?

sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is a family-owned and operated full-service fabrication and installation company servicing NWA that specializes in residential/commercial: quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: Survival Exhibition At The Jones Center Extended
posts.content:
If you haven't had the chance to enjoy “The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Experience” at The Jones Center, the immersive, STEM-based exhibition is extended through Jan 12, 2023, due to popular demand.

  • Put yourself to the test: “The Worst Case Scenario Survival Experience” engages guests in active problem-solving and hilarious full-body play as they put real-world survival skills to the test in scenarios like landing a plane, escaping quicksand, or outsmarting a mountain lion! 
  • Plan your visit: Reservations are available for parties and groups on Monday through Wednesday, with general admission available Thursday through Sunday. The exhibition is presented in English and Spanish, with Marshallese translations available. 

Reservations for groups and parties are filling up fast! Schedule your group HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville Has Two New Bars
posts.content:
Over the last few months, Downtown Bentonville has welcomed two new bars that sit across the street from each other off of SW A St. 

  • The Beacon: Beacon Beer Bar by Hawk Moth Brewing serves up some tasty beer with great vibes inside and out on their patio which is perfect for this fall time weather. 
  • Rope Hounds: Rope Hounds Taproom is a dog-friendly bar with 16 different beers on tap. Take your pup out for a brew, and pick up some of Rope Hounds' locally handcrafted dog gear. 

Keep up on social with the Beacon HERE and Rope Hounds HERE.

posts.title: Join The Square 2 Square Bike Ride This Weekend
posts.content:
Cyclists from across NW Arkansas will celebrate cycling, promote safe riding, and enjoy the amazing Razorback Greenway this Saturday in the Square 2 Square Bicycle Ride.

  • Go greenway: Riders will meet at Lawrence Plaza in Bentonville on Saturday morning, then make the 30 mi. journey down the Razorback Greenway to Walker Park in Fayetteville. 
  • Join the ride: Register to ride solo, with a group, or join the virtual option! The registration fee includes a goody bag, t-shirt, and finisher medal. Tickets for a shuttle service from Walker Park to Bentonville are available for those wanting to park a vehicle at the end of the ride.

Register to ride by Oct 5th HERE.

posts.title: Register To Vote In The Arkansas General Election
posts.content:
Are you registered to vote in the 2022 Arkansas General Election on Nov 8th? The deadline for voter registration is Oct 11th.

  • Register to vote: You can register online, or pick up an application at your local library, DMV, or revenue office. Follow this voter guide for important information on when and where to vote. 
  • Know the issues: This comprehensive voter guide on Arkansas Ballot Issues can help you learn what amendments to the Arkansas constitution have been proposed so you can make an informed vote. 

Learn more about this year’s general election HERE.

posts.title: The Blessings Collegiate Invitational Tees Off Today
posts.content:
The Blessings Collegiate Invitational begins today, giving players from 11 of the top men’s and women’s golf programs from around the country the opportunity to shine on a global stage and displaying the region’s world-class amenities. 

  • Let’s go Hogs: Last year, the hosting Razorback Golf Program captured all six tournament titles, and is ready to deliver another amazing performance this year for the third annual tournament at the Blessings Golf Club.
  • Welcome to NWA: Presented by Tyson Foods, all three days of official tournament play will be broadcast on Golf Channel Oct 3-5, making NW Arkansas the center of the collegiate golf world for the week.

Read more on the tournament HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Bulking season: Bella Vista and Fayetteville are hosting bulky waste removal events so residents can dispose of large items like household appliances.
  • Chug-a-choo-choo: Join the Rogers Historical Museum for The Great Cardboard Train Race on Oct 8th during the Frisco Inferno BBQ competition. 
  • Sweater weather: Check out Only in Arkansas’s Ultimate NWA Fall Color Guide to find the best places for taking in the beautiful fall foliage of the Ozarks.
  • Innovation station: The U of A’s Walton College of Business has launched a new Master’s degree program in product innovation. 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.
